page.title: 06Wharton Woods The gamekeeper
page.content: The gamekeeper of Wharton Woods is Patrick Plant. Mr Plant's job is to keep the wood in order. He controls pests by trapping and shooting.Themost destructive pest is the grey squirrel which strips the bark off the trees and leaves thm prone to disease. Mr Plant's other important task is to rear phesants and partridges for game. In the summer Mr Plant rises at 6 a.m., he attends to the pheasants to make sure they have clean water. He then checks the trapto see if he has caught anything. Summer is also the fishing season so he has to cherck the fisherman's permits. Mr Plant has two dogs one gun dog and a guard dog. He has a problem with poachers and thieves stealing the pheasants. Offenders are always prosicuted, if they are caught!
